alert.note: Alert for Fulton; Hamilton; Montgomery; Schoharie (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued December 23 at 1:29PM EST until December 23 at 1:45PM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 PM EST FOR SOUTHEASTERN HAMILTON...CENTRAL FULTON...NORTHWESTERN SCHOHARIE AND WESTERN MONTGOMERY COUNTIES... At 128 PM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from near Sacandaga Campground to near Springfield, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Flash freeze on roads. Intense bursts of heavy snow and gusty winds leading to blowing snow and visibility rapidly falling to less than one-quarter mile. Wind gusts greater than 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar and trained spotter. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This includes Interstate 90 near exit 29. This snow squall will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Hamilton, central Fulton, northwestern Schoharie and western Montgomery Counties, including the following locations... Meco, Cook Corners, Beekman Corners, Pinnacle, Engleville, Salt Springville, Mindenville, Fical Corners, Tomantown and Ripple Corners. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Wet roadways will quickly freeze. Black ice will cause roads, bridges, and overpasses to become slick and dangerous. Slow down and be prepared for a sudden loss of traction. Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions.
